content: be the foundation row that began your project mark the back loop for later work a standing flsc in that stitch you can work this entire back side of the envelope border in one color or if you prefer to do more colors that is up to you step 2 flsc across to corner chain 1 space work single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet in that space rotate your blanket step 3 working in the leg of the v closest to the body of the blanket work a single_crochet around each of those legs across to the other corner work single_crochet chain 1 single_crochet in that space rotate your blanket repeat steps 2 and 3 working in the back loops to reach the beginning stitch of the round and do an invisible join chain 2 single_crochet in same single_crochet as the join mark this stitch for clarity of where to join continue building the back until you are happy with the width of the border turn your project and find the marker you placed at the beginning of the back side repeat the process and work the same amount of row for the front i worked 5 rounds for each side then a joining round squeezebox ©2023 designed by ad whited designs ravelry com or etsy com 5
